                                November 2017


                               Design technology


                         Higher level and standard level


                                    Paper 2

     Question                                         Answers                                                          Notes                      Total
1.     a    i     6% ü                                                                                Award [1] for stating the percentage of
                                                                                                      oil used in plastic production in 2014.      1


            ii   106.5 x 365 million = 38,872.5 million (or 38,872,500,000)                           Award [1] for the correct answer.
                 38,872.5
                 ü        million x 0.06 = 2332.35 million barrels (or 2,332,350,000 barrels) ü
                                                                                                      Award [1] showing the working out.
                 or                                                                                   Final answer must be indicated in           2 max
                                                                                                      millions but does not need to include the
                 6% of 106.5= 6.39 ü                                                                  term ‘barrels’
                 6.39 x 365= 2332.35 million barrels ü

       b    i    renewable resources will not run out/can be replenished within a reasonable          Award [1] for identifying each difference
                 timeframe/are infinite                                                              between renewable and non-renewable
                                                                                                      energy up to [2].
                                                                                                                                                   2
                 non-renewable resources will run out/cannot be replenished as they do not re-form
                 at a rate that makes its use sustainable/are finite

            ii   dematerialization is a process that encourages the reduction of total material and   Award [1] for identifying a reason why
                 energy utilisation                                                                  manufacturers would use a strategy of
                 which can be beneficial from an economic/environmental standpoint/promote the        dematerialization of plastic products and
                 company as environmentally conscious/reduce the overall demand on oil/enhance        [1] for a brief explanation
                 green credentials                                                                   Do not award any marks for responses         2
                                                                                                      which simply state: 'dematerialization
                                                                                                      reduces amount of material used' or
                                                                                                      ‘less waste’

c   i    volume/continuous flow/mass production                                        Award [1] for identifying a scale of
         provides simple/consistent/rapid/precise production method                    production that would be appropriate for
                                                                                        the manufacture of plastic products        2 max
         volume/continuous flow/mass production                                        using injection moulding and [1] for a
         for manufacture in large quantities/benefits economies of scale               brief explanation

    ii   thermoplastics can be heated and reformed/have a linear chain structure/weak   Award [1] for each of three distinct
         polymer bond                                                                  points in a comparison of the ease pf
         thermosetting plastics can usually only be heated and formed once/have cross   recovery and disposal of thermoplastics
         linking polymers that form a strong bond                                      and thermosetting plastics.
         this means that thermoplastics can be repurposed/makes them more appropriate   Do not accept answers that simply state
         or viable for recycling                                                       that thermoset plastics cannot be           3
                                                                                        reheated/reformed.
                                                                                        Accept an appropriate example for the
                                                                                        third mark i.e. recycled drink bottles
                                                                                        used for clothing.

d   i    the total energy required to produce a product                        Award [1] for a correct definition of
                                                                                embodied energy                               1

    ii   cost effective                                                        Award [1] for identifying an advantage
         as it is a high volume/automated/mechanised production system         of injection moulded plastic and [1] for a
                                                                                brief explanation
         repeatability/consistency                                             Do not award a mark for
         as the exact same mould is utilised to produce all components/parts   “rapid production method”
                                                                                Do not award marks across different
         high precision/accuracy                                                                                            2 max
                                                                                clusters
         allows detailed features/complex shapes/textures/surface finishes

         efficient use of material
         waste is minimised/excess plastic can easily be recycled

                                                                                employing clean technology in the
         ensuring neutral impact                                               production of the Dish Doctor.
         minimising negative impacts through conserving natural resources      Do not accept answers such as “reduce
         reducing pollution and use of energy                                  environmental impact” or
                                                                                “environmentally friendly”                   2 max
         reducing wastage of energy and resources
         legislation
         incentives
         consumer/pressure groups/media

ii   solid models provide accurate data/a detailed impression of the                  Award [1] for each of three distinct
     product with dimensions and tolerances                                          points in an explanation of why solid
     which the designer uses to communicate/get feedback from client/manufacturers   modelling is advantageous in the
     making it easy to make necessary improvements/modifications                     development of the Dish Doctor.
                                                                                      Do not award marks across different
     solid models can measure the volume                                             clusters                                3 max
     to calculate the material quantity/cost
     optimising manufacturing capability

     solid models can test the structure of the materials
     to calculate the load (FEA) 
     optimising the performance of product

2.     a    i    form                                                                                   Award [1] for listing each aesthetic
                                                                                                         characteristic that the retro styled Nikon
                 texture
                                                                                                         DF shares with the original production
                 size/proportions                                                                       Nikon EL2.
                 shape                                                                                                                               2 max
                 colour scheme
                 placements of dials
                 placement of logo/branding

            ii   finger/thumb dimensions                                                                Award [1] for each two distinct pieces of
                 palm/hand size                                                                         anthropometric data that would be used
                                                                                                         in the design of a camera.                   2 max
                 viewing angle
                 size and dimensions of eye socket

3.               a design that uses the form/stylistic features/decoration from a particular period of   Award [1] for each of three distinct
                 time                                                                                   points in an explanation issues that
                 but is updated with newer technology/materials/components/ functionality               designers need to address when using
                 to make it more appropriate/functional for a new market/user                           retro styling.
                                                                                                         Do not award marks across different          3 max
                 a design that shares/respects the original designers intent                            clusters
                 by employing nostalgia
                 which triggers an emotional response/re-attracts previous/old customers who may
                 recognise/remember it from their childhood

4.               classic cars are representative of a specific period of time                           Award [1] for each of three distinct
                 triggering feelings of nostalgia/attachment                                            points in an explanation of how classic
                 and often increase in value long after they have ceased to be manufactured             design of a product such as a car
                                                                                                         transcends obsolescence.                      3
                 classic cars are timeless through their form                                           Do not award marks across different
                 which increases desirability due to their rarity                                       clusters
                 although newer cars are technologically advanced
                                                     –8–                         N17/4/DESTE/BP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M




obsolescence is when a product is no longer needed even though it may function
as well as it did when first manufactured
it remains in style/attains iconic status/has a strong image
which transcends across cultures/makes it recognisable
                                                                        –9–                                           N17/4/DESTE/BP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


                                                                     Section B

     Question                                             Answers                                                      Notes                       Total
5.     a        hardness                                                                            Award [1] for listing two distinct physical
                                                                                                     properties that could be improved by
                thermal conductivity / resistivity 
                                                                                                     alloying a metal.
                electrical conductivity / resistivity 
                density                                                                                                                           2 max
                weight 
                mass 
                volume 

       b        height of the seat                                                                  Award [1] for each of three distinct
                can be adjusted so that the pedals can be reached by people of different sizes      points in an explanation of how bicycles
                to allow people of different sizes to get maximum pedalling                          are adjustable.
                efficiency/comfort/minimize the risk of injuries
                                                                                                     Do not award marks across different
                                                                                                     clusters
                length between seat and handlebars
                both can be adjusted so the handlebars/grips can be reached by people of
                different sizes
                to get maximum steering control/reduce fatigue
                                                                                                                                                   3 max
                width/tilt/angle of handlebars
                so people of different sizes can adjust the bicycle to suit their shoulder
                width/wrists/hands
                to allow people of different sizes to get maximum steering control /comfort/reduce
                fatigue/ increase target market

                forks/frame dampening
                some bikes have adjustable suspension
                allowing the rider to customise the comfort according to terrain
                                                             – 10 –                                      N17/4/DESTE/BP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


c   relative advantage                                                                  Award [1] for each of three distinct
    how improved an innovation is over the previous generation                          points in an explanation of how each of
    consumers would see that the 3D printed bicycle has some advantages over             Rogers’ characteristics are applicable to
    previous bicycle designs                                                            the Renishaw 3D printer bicycle.

    compatibility
    the level of compatibility that an innovation has with an individual’s life         [3 max] for any two of Rogers’
    the 3D printed bicycle functions in the same way as existing bicycles, making it     characteristics.
    easy to be assimilated into an individual’s life
                                                                                         Do not award marks across different
    complexity                                                                          clusters
    the innovation should not be perceived as complicated or difficult to use
    the 3D printed bicycle is no more complex than existing bicycle so consumers
                                                                                                                                     6 max
    would not be deterred

    observability
    the extent that an innovation is visible to others by seeing others riding the 3D
    printed bicycle or in a bicycle shop
    visibility will drive communication among the individual’s peers and personal
    networks/create more positive or negative reactions

    trialability
    the degree to which the innovation may be trialled/tested on a temporary basis/for
    a limited time
    to give consumer a better understanding how the product performs/greater
    inclination to adopt the innovation 
                                                            – 11 –                                       N17/4/DESTE/BP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


d   cost effective                                                                      Award [1] for each of three distinct
    the time/skill required to assemble a traditional frame is high                     points in an explanation of the
    therefore, the labour cost of assembling the frame is much lower                    advantages of a manufacturer using
                                                                                         additive manufacturing for a bicycle
    reduction of waste                                                                  frame.
    instead of removing material, it ‘adds’ material layer by layer
    therefore, it only uses the exact amount of material required to manufacture the
    bicycle frame                                                                       [3 max] for any advantage.

    process efficiency
    traditional frame manufacture includes cutting/shaping/welding of tubes             Do not award marks across different
    3D printing enables the frame to be made as a single component in one process       clusters

    flexibility
    changes in frame design can be made without needing to change
                                                                                                                                9 max
    tooling/processes
    this allows the manufacturer to quickly adapt to changes as required by the
    market

    complexity of form
    traditional frames have comparatively simple forms
    additive manufacture allows more detailed/complex designs to be realised

    reduction in labour
    the manual tasks can now be done by a machine
    although the setup cost of machine is high, this cost will be recovered over time

    reduction of errors
    reducing the need of reprocessing the frame/parts of the frame
    due to mistakes made by human workers
                                                                            – 12 –                                        N17/4/DESTE/BP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                          Answers                                                             Notes                     Total
6.     a        constructive discontent                                                                  Award [1] for identifying the driver for
                analysing a situation that could benefit from a re-design, and then working out a         invention used by Brebner and [1] for a     2
                strategy to improve it                                                                   brief explanation

       b        lone inventors have creative freedom/complete ownership                                  Award [1] for each of three distinct
                but work in isolation/are self-funded/need skills from design to marketing/lack the       points in a discussion of the advantages
                opportunity for interaction with others/take on risk as they have to do everything       and disadvantages of being a lone           3
                however if the product is successful they gain recognition/attain financial               inventor.
                success
       c        stiffness                                                                                Award [1] for each of three distinct
                the resistance of an elastic body to deflection by an applied force                      points in an explanation of two
                the handle of the umbrella needs to be stiff to resist becoming permanently bent, if      mechanical properties of the materials
                the handle bends the umbrella will no longer function                                    used to manufacture the Brebner
                                                                                                          umbrella.
                toughness                                                                                Do not award marks across different
                the ability of a material to absorb energy and plastically deform without                 clusters
                fracturing/cracking
                if the handle or ribs of the umbrella were to fracture/crack it would no longer be
                usable/function
                                                                                                                                                     6 max
                tensile strength
                the ability of a material to withstand pulling forces
                when the wind blows over the umbrella the canopy material will be placed in
                tension, it must withstand this tension or it will tear

                elasticity
                the ability of a material to return to its original shape
                If the umbrella is blown inside out it will return to its original shape/shape will not
                have stretched
                                                              – 13 –                                         N17/4/DESTE/BP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


d   aesthetic models                                                                       Award [1] for each of three distinct
    look like the final model and are used for evaluating aesthetic appeal                 points in an explanation of the different
    the designer could have used aesthetic models to consider the different colour          types of physical models the designer
    combinations to offer the umbrella in                                                  could have used in the development of
                                                                                            the Brebner umbrella.
    mock-ups
    is a scaled or full sized replica
    which helps communicate form/proportions of the design/gain feedback from               Do not award marks across different
                                                                                            clusters
    users

    prototypes
    to test the mechanisms and validate the design/test for functionality
                                                                                                                                        9 max
    and make necessary changes to improve the performance

    instrumented model
    measured testing of wind force could be carried out
    to determine the strength of the internal structure if the umbrella/its resistance to
    folding under strong wind pressure

    scale models
    scale models are a larger or smaller physical copy of an object
    the designer could have used scale models to work out the detail of the folding
    mechanisms – which would be too small to model at full size
                                                                        – 14 –                                  N17/4/DESTE/BP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                        Answers                                                     Notes                      Total
7.     a        analogy                                                                       Award [1] for identifying the strategy for
                an idea from one context is used to stimulate ideas for solving a problem in   innovation used in the development of
                another context                                                               the Coral Pendant Light and [1] for a         2
                                                                                               brief explanation

       b        accuracy/consistency                                                          Award [1] for each of three distinct
                the CNC router cuts the pieces identically                                    points in an explanation of the benefit of
                which allows all components to fit together precisely/with no error           using a CNC router in the development
                                                                                               of the Coral Pendant Light
                reduced waste                                                                 Do not award marks across different
                the pieces can be nested together to achieve least possible wastage of         clusters
                material/bamboo plywood
                which saves material costs/reduces waste that would need to be disposed of
                                                                                                                                            3 max
                speed of manufacture/reduced manufacturing time
                with no need for additional finishing/sanding
                which saves manufacturing time

                reduced labour
                mechanising the production reduces the amount/skill of labour required
                which reduces the overall production cost;
                                                            – 15 –                                         N17/4/DESTE/BP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


c   transportation                                                                       Award [1] for each of three distinct
    an assembled lamp would take up more space, by using a kitset the                     points in an explanation of the benefit of
    environmental impact/energy cost is reduced                                          using LCA in the selling of the Coral
                                                                                          Pendant Light.
    when transporting the product from factory to retailers
                                                                                          Do not award marks across different
    distribution                                                                         clusters.
    size of packaging
                                                                                                                                       6 max
    an assembled lamp would require a larger package, by using a kitset the quantity
    of packaging materials is reduced

    disposal
    disassembly of Pendant Light
    the kitset can be disassembled which allows for easy collection/disposal at the end
    of its life;
d   design for materials                                                                 Award [1] for each of three distinct
    the product would be designed considering locally available materials                points in an explanation of the
    the bamboo used may be grown in renewable forests which is more sustainable           manufacture strategies that have been
    than other timber species                                                            made to make the Coral Pendant Light
                                                                                          a green design.
    design for process                                                                   Candidates should include the full name
    using a specific manufacturing process such as CNC, enables the parts to be           of the strategy. i.e. “design for
    closely nested/cut more accurately                                                   materials”, “design for process” etc.
    which minimises waste/defects/errors                                                 Do not award marks across different          9 max
                                                                                          clusters.
    design for assembly
    designing taking account of assembly at various levels
    (component to component, components into sub-assemblies, sub-assemblies to
    complete products) 
    the lamp is sold as a kitset which reduces the environmental impact of distribution
    of a larger pre-assembled product
                                                      – 16 –                    N17/4/DESTE/BP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


design for disassembly
designing a product so when it becomes obsolete it can easily/economically be
taken apart
enabling components to be reused or repaired and materials recycled
